detailsOfAchievement: The Trust has from the day of its incorporation commenced social activities to achieve its objects for which it is formed. Conducted various programs of awareness and on current topics - Drinking Water, Jal Sanchay, Health,Hygiene and Sanitation, Importance of Mass Prayers, Collective Efforts, Agricultural activities with minimal use of water,Yoga Sessions, interaction with natives of villages to fight CORONA, Youths

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The Trust was created on Wednesday, 18th of March,2020. An amount of Rs.1111 was settled by the settler towards the Corpus Fund of the Trust. Founder Trustees contributed a further sum of Rs. 25000 out of which 21000 was contributed to PMCares Fund for COVID-19 and balance amount spent on awareness programs on Corona, Health, Hygiene and Sanitation and on importance of Saamuhik Prayers. Motivated Youths of the Village to be vigilant and to contribute to development of Rural India.

The Trust has not yet received any Grant from any Government Agency or Department. It has contributed on its own out of contributions received from the well wishers. Have organized programs on Covid-19, have organized Yoga Sessions on International Yoga Divas and have conducted awareness programs on JAL SANCHAY - JAL HI JEEVAN HAI, Agricultural activities with minimal consumption of Water, Environment and role of Trees etc.

detailsOfAchievement: SAHAYTA â€œExtending hands to accidental victimsâ€ Sahayta as an organization has reinvented itself in 2014 and working with great focus and renewed vigor. In the year 1995 it was the first organization of its kind in the state of Rajasthan and has since then been creating awareness on the Basic Life Saving (BLS) Course which covers handling injuries from top to toe, transporting the seriously injured in the correct manner at the earliest and also Cardio Pulmonary Cerebral Resuscitation (CPCR) method to restart the Heart and Lungs should they stop functioning. It thus serves the purpose of helping the needy, saving the life, and serving the humanity, fulfilling the objectives of CSR. While practicing CPCR, the norms American Heart Association and European Resuscitation Council guidelines are finely- tuned with an Indian perspective. It plays a video clip for ideal grasp of the technique. Learning CPCR is a necessary adjunct to any module related to the Road Safety. Presently there is no awareness amongst the public and the officials regarding the manner of support public can give at the site of accident. CHAIRPERSON, Dr. Maya Tandon has worked as Professor and Head, Department of Anesthesiology & Superintendent Jaykaylon Hospital, SMS Medical College, Jaipur. Since her superannuation in the year 1995, she has totally devoted herself to the cause of safety of injured persons, be it at home, work place or on the road. It has also broadened its purview to expand the activities to cover National and International arena. The other office bearers of the trust are: Secretary Mr. Tara Chand Saharan RAS (Retd.) Treasurer Dr. Kiran Tandon, Dental Surgeon Trustee Dr. Rashmi Sharma MD (Anaes) Pune (Ex. Army) Trustee Dr. Achla Kapoor MD (Gynae & Obs) Dr. SandeepTandon BDS, MDS (LKO) Ashish Sharma M.Com (EAFM) Liaison Officer; Program Coordinator Raj Agrawal M.A (Sociology, History) & BJMC International Prince Michael International Road Safety Award (2006) by Institute of Road Traffic Education (IRTE). National Nominated Member of NATIONAL ROAD SAFETY COUNCIL by MORTH, GOI, 2016. Lifetime Achievement Award by ISA at Udaipur (2013) 4th National Road Safety Award (2004) by the Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport & Highways (MORTH), GOI, New Delhi (2006) State Felicitation by Honâ€™ble Minister for Transport and PWD, GOR (2016) Member of Rajasthan Road Safety Policy Member of Rajasthan Road Safety Council District District Level Road Safety Award (2006) by Govt. of Rajasthan. Project: Community based initiatives to reduce Road Accident Mortality on NH8- Amer to Shahjahanpur (2004 to 2006) by NHAI. Other commitments: Participation in road safety weeks in schools, colleges, corporate etc., Collaboration with NGOâ€™s, and other venues round the year. Produced a film Aakhir Kab Tak conveying strong message making the public competent and save lives of seriously injured victims. Introduced MAAM (MOHALLA ACCIDENT ASSISTANCE MEMBERSHIP-also a means to convey regard to women), a public welfare initiative. We invite public from the surrounding colonies in the vicinity aiming to make this area a casualty free zone in coming years.

Samantar started Muhim Project in ten Govt.
